Über Jüne Status

Fri, 06/19/2009 - 08:48 | by Jesse

About two-thirds of the way through June and here's my status:

  • Rejuvinatin' June - When I tried to sit down to stretch after my second run, I just fell flat on my butt. Cycling muscles are totally different from running muscles.
  • Art Guy July - Haven't started
  • Alcoholic August - We've done a "tasting" (got drunk) and are going to buy ingredients this weekend
  • Back to school September - Still learning
  • Rocktobersaurus - LSDJ on backorder - should arrive around the end of the month
  • Notebooking November - Shit - I haven't done this...
  • Dress up December - I've been wearing collared shirts all week - not one person has asked if I've had an interview! Weird...
  • Classified as January - Also haven't started on this
  • Friendly February - I've been talking to a lot of new but normal/un-blogworthy people (no offense.) The hugs haven't been at 100% though...
  • Monthly Challenge Makeover March - Moved all of my sites into SVN. Haven't actually done any coding for this site though
  • Arcadalicious April - Got the top ten high scores on Asteroids at barcade
  • Mandex May - Completed the AIDS LifeCycle
  • Add new comment

Über Jüne Details

Sun, 06/07/2009 - 09:57 | by Jesse

So here is a better description of what I will be doing this month:

  • Rejuvinatin' June - Begin training for the Disneyland half marathon
  • Art Guy July - Screenprint a few T-Shirts
  • Alcoholic August - Start brewing beer
  • Back to school September - Learn about: brewing beer, bicycle maintenance
  • Rocktobersaurus - Record 1 song using LSDJ
  • Notebooking November - Doodle in notebooks throughout the month
  • Dress up December - Collared shirts at work for at least one full week
  • Classified as January - Sell more stuff I don't need on craigslist...sorry guys, no more craigslist dates
  • Friendly February - Talk to a new person each day and bring back the hugs
  • Monthly Challenge Makeover March - Reorganize this site and make it easier to find new posts, groups, etc.
  • Arcadalicious April - Get the top 5 high scores on a barcade arcade machine
  • Mandex May - Complete the AIDS LifeCycle

I've already completed ALC 8, and have started learning about brewing beer (thanks to Stump) and bicycle maintenance. On the ALC ride, I also got to meet tons of awesome people, and there was definitely a lot of hugging going on. I will make sure to continue that trend for this month.

Those are the only updates I have so far since last week was spent eating, sleeping, and cycling... I'll be sure to upload pictures, stories, mp3s, etc. of all of the above challenges as the month goes on.

Training No More

Wed, 05/27/2009 - 07:17 | by Jesse

The past two days have been rest days for me as I've been getting ready to ship my bike up to San Francisco for the ALC ride. Granted, I didn't hit my goal for this week or the week before, but I've ridden farther than I ever would've imagined I could in 25 days.

It's All About the First Century

Mon, 05/18/2009 - 08:24 | by Jesse

I'm starting my second day of rest this week, which means I'm probably not going to reach 350 miles by Friday. But to be honest, it's not a huge deal to me because yesterday, I finished my first century (a 100 mile ride). I rode from Griffith Park to Santa Monica, then up the PCH past Malibu and back the same route. My legs are pretty sore and I'm fairly tired, but I feel great.

  • 1 comment

294

Fri, 05/15/2009 - 08:36 | by Jesse

I am so exhausted right now, so I'll keep this short and boring...

Mileage this week:

  • Friday: Rest
  • Saturday: 80
  • Sunday: 50
  • Monday: 15
  • Tuesday: 55
  • Wednesday: 40
  • Thursday: 54

For a total of 294miles which is almost 300, but not quite. Still, that's a lot of miles to cycle in one week.

new roll! er... square

Wed, 05/13/2009 - 18:28 | by Sham

  still chugging along on the pola-poem express. on may 11th i switched to a new block of film. it's no ordinary polaroid 600 film. no, no, this film was giving to me for christmas in 2007 and it was packed in my suitcase that i checked at the manchester airport in NH. seeing as i arrived way early and checked my bag immediately, i assumed my luggage would make it on the plane. alas, manchester demonstrated its vast incompetence when i found out, upon arriving at LAX, that my bags didn't make the transfer because they never ever got on the plane in NH.
